intro: Gyaladenia conica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bell heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in early spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gyaladenia conica is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these specialized habitats.
